Chapman 11:00 AM | 310 King St, Port Colborne Available March 8 to June 8, 2021 If you enjoy bird watching, then this is the presentation for you! Everything from the small backyard visitors that we all know and love, to some of the largest birds like the Bald Eagle and Great Blue Heron. Check out rare visitors to the Niagara area like the Painted Bunting and Northern Hawk Owl. Watch an owl family grow up and leave the nest. Learn how you can enhance your birding experience. Chapman 11:00 AM | 310 King St, Port Colborne Available March 8 to June 8, 2021 If you enjoy bird watching, then this is the presentation for you! Everything from the small backyard visitors that we all know and love, to some of the largest birds like the Bald Eagle and Great Blue Heron. Check out rare visitors to the Niagara area like the Painted Bunting and Northern Hawk Owl. Watch an owl family grow up and leave the nest. Learn how you can enhance your birding experience. Our travel guide, weather expert David T. Chapman, takes us on a journey literally from the ground up. All ages. Free. Register online. The YouTube link to the program will be emailed to the email address you provided at a later date. 30 Apr Take & Make Kit: Monarch Butterfly Gardens 11:00 AM | 310 King St, Port Colborne Available during curbside hours at the library starting April 30, while supplies last. All ages. Every week, your family can order a kit to make an amazing craft. Call to book your kit: 905-834-6512. Available while supplies last! $1 per craft. Please have exact change ready at pick-up. All craft kits have been quarantined for four days. Instructions and most supplies included (some glue or common household items may be required). Online Zoom Tutorial Saturday, June 12, 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. For all ages. Free. Available while supplies last. From sleek sea turtles to sturdy, land-based tortoises, turtles come in many shapes and sizes, and can be found in different habitats. They also face many threats, so they need our help! Kids create unique turtle sculptures to inspire people and raise awareness. They start by sculpting a coil to make the shell and then add extra pieces and colors to make their own turtle sculptures. Mark your calendars to kick off your summer reading with us! Create a unique turtle sculpture in this fun art workshop and learn about wildlife conservation. Register for the program, pick up your art supply kit prior to the event, and then join us for a live, online tutorial. Reserve your spot: 905-834-6512. Chapman 11:00 AM | 310 King St, Port Colborne Available March 8 to June 8, 2021 If you enjoy bird watching, then this is the presentation for you! Everything from the small backyard visitors that we all know and love, to some of the largest birds like the Bald Eagle and Great Blue Heron. Check out rare visitors to the Niagara area like the Painted Bunting and Northern Hawk Owl. Watch an owl family grow up and leave the nest. Learn how you can enhance your birding experience. See both still images and video of these fascinating and colourful characters and more. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WhoJBSSfIU0 19 May 3-2-1 Weather Launch: Atmosphere Traveler with David T. Chapman 11:00 AM | 310 King St, Port Colborne Available April 12 to July 12, 2021 Become your family's weather forecaster by learning to read weather patterns just from looking at the sky outside your window. Our travel guide, weather expert David T. Chapman, takes us on a journey literally from the ground up. All ages. Free. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XRT0ykiQCfI&t=2s 21 May Take & Make Kit: Good in Every Grain 11:00 AM | 310 King St, Port Colborne Available during curbside hours at the library starting May 21, while supplies last. All craft kits have been quarantined for four days. Instructions and most supplies included (some glue or common household items may be required). Online Zoom Tutorial Saturday, June 12, 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. For all ages. Free. Available while supplies last. From sleek sea turtles to sturdy, land-based tortoises, turtles come in many shapes and sizes, and can be found in different habitats. They also face many threats, so they need our help! Kids create unique turtle sculptures to inspire people and raise awareness. They start by sculpting a coil to make the shell and then add extra pieces and colors to make their own turtle sculptures. Mark your calendars to kick off your summer reading with us! Create a unique turtle sculpture in this fun art workshop and learn about wildlife conservation. Register for the program, pick up your art supply kit prior to the event, and then join us for a live, online tutorial. Reserve your spot: 905-834-6512. 28 May Take & Make Kit: Bird Nests 11:00 AM | 310 King St, Port Colborne Available during curbside hours at the library starting May 28, while supplies last. Chapman 11:00 AM | 310 King St, Port Colborne Available March 8 to June 8, 2021 If you enjoy bird watching, then this is the presentation for you! Everything from the small backyard visitors that we all know and love, to some of the largest birds like the Bald Eagle and Great Blue Heron. Check out rare visitors to the Niagara area like the Painted Bunting and Northern Hawk Owl. Watch an owl family grow up and leave the nest. Learn how you can enhance your birding experience. The first virtual open house is happening next Wednesday, June 2 at 6:30 p.m. If residents are interested in participating at the virtual public open house, they are asked to email lockviewpark@portcolborne.ca. Online Zoom Tutorial Saturday, June 12, 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. For all ages. Free. Available while supplies last. From sleek sea turtles to sturdy, land-based tortoises, turtles come in many shapes and sizes, and can be found in different habitats. They also face many threats, so they need our help! Kids create unique turtle sculptures to inspire people and raise awareness. They start by sculpting a coil to make the shell and then add extra pieces and colors to make their own turtle sculptures. Mark your calendars to kick off your summer reading with us! Create a unique turtle sculpture in this fun art workshop and learn about wildlife conservation. Register for the program, pick up your art supply kit prior to the event, and then join us for a live, online tutorial. Online Zoom Tutorial Saturday, June 12, 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. For all ages. Free. Available while supplies last. From sleek sea turtles to sturdy, land-based tortoises, turtles come in many shapes and sizes, and can be found in different habitats. They also face many threats, so they need our help! Kids create unique turtle sculptures to inspire people and raise awareness. They start by sculpting a coil to make the shell and then add extra pieces and colors to make their own turtle sculptures. Knoll Park Pavillion The Optimist Club will be giving away free books at the Pavillion at H.H. Knoll Park on July 24th. The books range from Toddlers to Teen. Max 4 per person. All books are new and uncirculated. 24 Jul Bringing Stars to the Library with Bill Burnyeat 03:00 PM | 310 King St, Port Colborne Saturday, July 24, 2021, 3:00 to 3:30 p.m. Online registration starts: June 24, 2021. A virtual Zoom program for families. Limited spaces. Reserve your place. Register now: Link! Summer is a great time for stargazing and enjoying the starry skies above you! Sign up for this amazing virtual program and learn how you can become a backyard astronomer. We welcome our guide to the sky Bill Burnyeat of Canadian Planetariums to teach us more about backyard astronomy. Have a question about astronomy? Submit your question in the space provided on the registration page or return the provided page in the newsletter for a chance to have your question answered during the presentation! 30 Jul Take & Make Kit: Clifford the Big Red Dog 10:00 AM | 310 King St, Port Colborne Available during curbside hours at the library starting July 30, while supplies last. All ages. Every week, your family can order a kit to make an amazing craft. Call to book your kit: 905-834-6512. Available while supplies last! Free. Instructions and most supplies included (some glue or common household items may be required). Starting in Peterborough on September 19th, 2021 and heading south towards Toronto, Burlington, Hamilton, St. Catharines, and Niagara Falls, and then running through Fort Erie and Port Colborne on September 24, before looping back towards London, Cambridge, and Kitchener, and ending near Barrie on October 9th, 2021. Relay runners will run approximately 30km and 50km segments over 21 days on the Great Trail and Waterfront Trail. The running event is entirely organized by a volunteer team who are passionate about protecting the Earth and are on a mission to inspire communities to get involved in conservation action! Registration for the Monarch Ultra Relay Run opens on March 1st, 2021. To get on the waiting list, please send an email to themonarchultra@gmail.com. 24 Sep Take & Make Kit: It's All in the Cards 10:00 AM | 310 King St, Port Colborne Available during curbside and browsing hours at the library starting September 24, while supplies last. Ages 16 and older. $3.00 per kit. Every week, your family can order a kit to make an amazing craft. You can pick up your kit during our curbside and browsing hours. Instructions and most supplies included (some glue or common household items may be required). Available while quantities last. Prices as marked. Call to book your kit: 905-834-6512. Starting in Peterborough on September 19th, 2021 and heading south towards Toronto, Burlington, Hamilton, St. Catharines, and Niagara Falls, and then running through Fort Erie and Port Colborne on September 24, before looping back towards London, Cambridge, and Kitchener, and ending near Barrie on October 9th, 2021. Relay runners will run approximately 30km and 50km segments over 21 days on the Great Trail and Waterfront Trail. The running event is entirely organized by a volunteer team who are passionate about protecting the Earth and are on a mission to inspire communities to get involved in conservation action! Registration for the Monarch Ultra Relay Run opens on March 1st, 2021. To access the series, participants will need a computer, phone, or tablet with internet and the Zoom app. All participants must be register online. Once registered, participants will receive an email approximately one week prior to each event containing all the relevant login information. Free. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XRT0ykiQCfI 28 Oct Brock Talks 06:30 PM | Online Port Colborne's Tennessee Avenue and the Humberstone Summer Resort Company The second Brock Talk of the 2021/22 season will be given by Michelle Vosburgh (Canadian Studies) When: October 28th 6:30 p.m. Where: Zoom This event is free and all are welcome. Advance registration is required. Please register at https://scplbrocktalkoctober.eventbrite.ca. Brock Talks are a partnership between the Faculty of Humanities and the St. Catharines Public Library. This talk has been co-organized by the Centre for Canadian Studies. 28 Oct Canadian Arthurs Series: Speak Silence by Kim Echlin 07:00 PM | Virtual From the author of the internationally bestselling and Scotiabank Giller prize shortlisted The Disappeared comes an astounding, poetic novel about war and loss, suffering and courage, and the strength of women through it all. To access the series, participants will need a computer, phone, or tablet with internet and the Zoom app. All participants must be register online. Once registered, participants will receive an email approximately one week prior to each event containing all the relevant login information.
